means: 继续存在( last的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: Only the achievement of these goals will bring lasting peace.
sentence.Network_cn: 只有达成这些目标才会带来持久的和平。

sentence.Network_en: Sugar gives quick relief to hunger but provides no lasting nourishment.
sentence.Network_cn: 糖能快速缓解饥饿感，但不能提供持久的营养。

sentence.Network_en: Even minor head injuries can cause long-lasting psychological effects.
sentence.Network_cn: 即使是轻微的头部创伤也会对心理产生长期影响。

entry.def: You can use lasting to describe a situation, result, or agreement that continues to exist or have an effect for a very long time.

example.ex: We are well on our way to a lasting peace...
example.tran: 我们已在实现持久和平上取得很大进展。

example.ex: She left a lasting impression on him.
example.tran: 她给他留下了难以磨灭的印象。

means.word_mean: 1. continuing or enduring without marked change in status or condition or place;
4. lasting a long time without change;
5. lasting for an indefinitely long period of time

auth_sentence.content: Ultimately, the body has no lasting law-making power.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ultimately, the body has no lasting law-making power.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ultimately, the body has no lasting law-making power.

auth_sentence.content: Lasting peace cannot simply be declared by fiat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lasting peace cannot simply be declared by fiat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lasting peace cannot simply be declared by fiat.

auth_sentence.content: Most children recover from mumps with no long-lasting problems.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most children recover from mumps with no long-lasting problems.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most children recover from mumps with no long-lasting problems.

Sentence.sentence: To curb the fear of a lasting free fall.

sentences.en: After an artillery bombardment lasting several days the town finally succumbed.
sentences.cn: 在持续炮轰数日后,该城终于屈服了。
